body: ## Employee Goal Setting and Evaluation Process ### Instructions The goal setting and evaluation process is designed to be an ongoing conversation between manager and employee throughout the year. ### Documents & Resources Step 1. Goal Setting form Step 2. Mid Year Check In form Step 3a. Employee Self-Evaluation form Step 3b. Overall Evaluation form Department Strategic Plans Metro HR Individual Development Plan ### Definitions SMART goal: A goal that is Specific, Measurable, Actionable, Realistic, and Time-bound. Examples: • Achieve a 95% or better satisfaction rating from my customers for Service Desk experience for the period of January to June 2014. • Interview all permanent and 10% of seasonal guest services staff to help determine guest service opportunities and needs by May 2014. Department goal: A specific outcome that a department wants to achieve that is recorded in the department’s current Strategic Plan (Available in Sharepoint > LMG Strategic Planning). Goal health: Describes whether or not the goal or initiative is on track using a color-coded scale: • Green (On track): Completed or in progress, on schedule, and expected to be completed on time • Yellow (Slightly off track): In progress, but behind schedule and with issues that might affect completion date • Red (Off track): Not started, overdue, or in progress but behind schedule and with issues that affect completion date
